frame.name: Being_in_category
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Item</fen> belongs to a <fen>Category</fen>, as (often implicitly) conceived of by a <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">To me</fex> <fex name="Item">this</fex> <t>counts</t> <fex name="Category">as historical fiction</fex> <fex name="Criteria">because it is based on real events</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the person who performs an act of categorization. Typically, this frame element is expressed as an oblique.
<ex>But <fex name="Cog">to me</fex>, a bad thought <t>constitutes</t> a sin just as well. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Item
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the entity which is is an instance of a particular <fen>Category</fen>. Typically, the <fen>Item</fen> is expressed as the external argument.
<ex>To me, <fex name="Item">finding this</fex> <m>is</m> <t>tantamount</t> <fex name="Category">to finding the fabeled El Dorado</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Category
FE.definition:
<def-root>This frame element expresses a general type or class of which the <fen>Item</fen> is considered an instance. Typically, it is expressed in a prepositional phrase headed by <ment>as</ment> or <ment>under</ment>.
<ex>I'd say that this book <t>counts</t> <fex name="Cat">as fiction</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Criteria
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element expresses properties of the <fen>Item</fen> which is used as a basis for categorization. <fen>Criteria</fen> are the general dimensions along which <fen>Item</fen>s can potentially differ from one another and hence, fall into different <fen>Category</fen>s. For example, a paint sample can be classified <ment>by color</ment> or <ment>by finish (matte or gloss)</ment>; if they are classified by color, one can be classified <ment>as orange</ment> and another <ment>as red</ment>. The <fen>Criteria</fen> FE is typically expressed as a PP headed by <ment>by</ment>, or as a complex PP of the form <ment>on the basis of...</ment>: <ex>If it <t>counts</t> as knowledge in part <fex name="Crit">on the basis of justification from another source</fex>, it must be in part based on that source </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> in which an <fen>Item</fen> (metaphorically) is construed as being in a <fen>Category</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An act or state of affairs by which the <fen>Item</fen> (perhaps metaphorically) is interpreted as being in a <fen>Category</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate when a certain Categorization holds.
<ex>Fold in inflation and what <t>counted</t> as shameful gouging <fex name="Time">20 years ago</fex> is today called charging what the market will bear.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> are the set of conditions in which the categorization holds. <ex>Material posessions <t>count</t> as valuable <fex name="Circumstances">in a particular society</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: tantamount.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: equivalent in seriousness to; virtually the same as.

lexUnit.name: constitute.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be or be equivalent to.
